sentence.Network_en: This basic utilitarian model gives a relatively unsophisticated account of human behaviour.
sentence.Network_cn: 这个实用的基础模型较为简略地解释了人类的行为。

sentence.Network_en: The British are considered ill-mannered, badly dressed and unsophisticated.
sentence.Network_cn: 英国人被认为缺乏教养、衣着邋遢、头脑简单。

sentence.Network_en: Do not be rather unsophisticated in the complicated political struggle.
sentence.Network_cn: 在错综复杂的政治斗争中不要太天真了!

entry.tran: 单纯的；不懂世故的；没经验的
entry.def: Unsophisticated people do not have a wide range of experience or knowledge and have simple tastes.

example.ex: It was music of a rather crude kind which unsophisticated audiences enjoyed listening to...
example.tran: 这是一种平民品味的听众喜欢听的简单粗糙的音乐形式。

example.ex: She was quite unsophisticated in the ways of the world.

entry.def: An unsophisticated method or device is very simple and often not very effective.

means.word_mean: 1. not wise in the ways of the world;

sentences.sentence: "either too unsophisticated or too honest to promise more than he could deliver"

"the nightlife of Montmartre awed the unsophisticated tourists"
